intro: Dubautia × fucosa, commonly known as the hybridhoa or hybrid Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and often branched. Dubautia × fucosa is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii and thrives in well-drained soils.
